ðŸš€ pickle_berry | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Fast file management using a keyboard-centric interface in a terminal environment.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ TUI based file manager â€¢ Keyboard driven interface â€¢ Lightweight and shell based â€¢ Dynamic keybindings â€¢ Basic file operations (move, copy, rename, delete)
ðŸ“– Summary: pickleBerry is a shell-based, TUI file manager designed for efficient keyboard-driven file operations. It provides a lightweight alternative to traditional graphical file managers, offering dynamic keybindings and essential file management features within a terminal interface. It requires familiarity with basic shell commands and relies on dependencies like bash, fzf, and tput.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ mousemaster | Java
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Mouseless mouse manipulation for improved accessibility and productivity.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Keyboard-driven mouse control â€¢ Normal mode (IJKL keys) â€¢ Hint mode (labeled hints) â€¢ Grid mode (screen division) â€¢ Screen selection mode (multi-monitor support)
ðŸ“– Summary: Mousemaster enables users to control their mouse cursor using only a keyboard, offering an alternative to traditional mouse input. It provides multiple navigation modes, including normal, hint, grid, and screen selection, all of which are fully customizable. This tool aims to enhance accessibility and productivity by providing a mouseless experience.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ Scraperr | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Extracting data from websites with precision using XPath selectors.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ XPath-Based Extraction â€¢ Queue Management â€¢ Domain Spidering â€¢ Custom Headers â€¢ Media Downloads
ðŸ“– Summary: Scraperr is a self-hosted web scraping solution that allows users to extract data from websites using XPath selectors. It provides a user-friendly interface for managing scraping jobs, visualizing results, and exporting data in various formats. Key features include XPath-based extraction, queue management, domain spidering, and media downloads.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ stegcloak | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Hiding secrets within text using steganography for covert communication, watermarking, and data exfiltration.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Password protection and HMAC integrity â€¢ AES-256-CTR encryption â€¢ Uses invisible Unicode characters â€¢ Maximum compression (LZ, Huffman) â€¢ Fast steganography
ðŸ“– Summary: StegCloak is a JavaScript steganography tool that hides secrets within text by compressing, encrypting, and cloaking them with invisible Unicode characters. It offers password protection, integrity checks, and high-speed performance, making it suitable for various applications like watermarking, covert communication, and data exfiltration via text.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ awesome-privacy | Astro
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing users with a comprehensive resource for finding privacy and security-focused alternatives to mainstream software and services.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Curated list of privacy and security-focused software and services
ðŸ“– Summary: The awesome-privacy repository is a curated list of privacy and security-focused software and services, categorized for easy browsing. It aims to help users migrate to open-source alternatives that respect their privacy and protect their data from corporations, governments, and hackers. The repository is mirrored on Codeberg and encourages contributions from the community.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ fingerprint-suite | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Anonymizing web scrapers by generating and injecting browser fingerprints.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Generates configurable, realistic HTTP headers. â€¢ Generates realistic browser fingerprints affecting HTTP headers and browser JS APIs. â€¢ Injects browser fingerprints into Playwright or Puppeteer managed browser instances.
ðŸ“– Summary: The fingerprint-suite repository provides tools for generating and injecting browser fingerprints to anonymize web scrapers. It includes modules for generating realistic HTTP headers and browser fingerprints, injecting these fingerprints into Playwright or Puppeteer instances, and a Bayesian network implementation for fingerprint generation.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ panel | PHP
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing game servers through a web interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Game server management panel â€¢ Open-source â€¢ Runs game servers in isolated Docker containers â€¢ Intuitive UI
ðŸ“– Summary: Pterodactyl Panel is an open-source game server management panel that allows users to easily manage game servers through a web interface. It utilizes Docker containers to isolate game servers, enhancing security and resource management. The panel provides an intuitive UI for end users to control their game servers.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ exifLooter | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Extracting geolocation data from image metadata for OSINT and security purposes.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Finds geolocation on image URLs and directories â€¢ Integrates with OpenStreetMap â€¢ Analyzes specific images and directories â€¢ Pipes with other tools â€¢ Removes metadata from images
ðŸ“– Summary: ExifLooter is a Go-based tool designed to extract geolocation data from image metadata. It can analyze individual images, entire directories, and even process URLs piped from other tools. The tool also integrates with OpenStreetMap to provide visual context for the extracted location data and offers functionality to remove metadata from images.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ scira | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: AI-powered search engine that finds information on the internet and cites it.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AI-powered search using Anthropic's Models â€¢ Web search using Tavily's API â€¢ URL Specific search â€¢ Weather information using OpenWeather's API â€¢ Code execution using E2B's API
ðŸ“– Summary: Scira is a minimalistic AI-powered search engine designed to help users find information on the internet with proper citations. It leverages various AI models and APIs to provide features like web search, URL-specific search, weather information, code execution, location details, YouTube search, academic search, and more. Scira aims to provide a comprehensive search experience powered by AI.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
